metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45062 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Xfce xfce4-settings before 4.16.4 and 4.17.x before 4.17.1, there is anargument injection vulnerability in xfce4-mime-helper.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xfce4-helpers - 4.16.2-1ubuntu2.22.04.1
xfce4-settings - 4.16.2-1ubuntu2.22.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xfce4-settings package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.2-1ubuntu2.22.04.1').
